title: THE CITY;Forger of Papers For Aliens Is Jailed
body:
A 25-year-old Brooklyn College student was sentenced to six months in jail and fined $5,000 yesterday for 
providing forged documents to illegal aliens seeking to remain in the United States.

In sentencing the defendant, Jose Del Castillo of Manhattan, Judge Charles L. Brieant Jr. of Federal District Court 
in Manhattan said he was concerned that ''in times of high unemployment'' the Government was ''unable to or 
unwilling to enforce the immigration laws.''
A 25-year-old Brooklyn College student was sentenced to six months in jail and fined $5,000 yesterday for 
providing forged documents to illegal aliens seeking to remain in the United States.

A probation report on the defendant said he had ''provided forged documents for approximately 300 people, 
charging $300 to $500 per package.'' The allegation was disputed by Mr. Del Castillo, a native of the Dominican 
Republic, who has been in the United States for 12 years and is a permanent resident.
